title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Well-known drug could make human blood toxic for malaria-transmitting mosquitoes
items.description: Field study in Kenya suggests innovative strategy has promise—but some researchers question its viability

items.title: Songbirds play optical tricks to make their feather colors ‘pop’
items.description: Concealed black or white bands on feathers boost the vibrancy of bird plumage

items.title: This scientist advises the U.K. government on climate policy—and it has to hear him out
items.description: As Piers Forster steps down as chair of the influential Climate Change Committee, he chats to Science about his role in guiding the country toward decarbonization

items.title: Most of Earth’s critical underground fungus is unprotected
items.description: First global map of mushrooms that form beneficial relationships with plant roots reveals 90% live outside of conservation areas

items.title: Controversial ‘gene-drive’ strategy could make mosquitoes hostile to malaria parasites
items.description: New approach aims to reduce disease transmission by quickly spreading a gene variant that occurs naturally in some mosquitoes

items.title: ‘We’re in uncharted waters.’ Hacking swamps could curb methane emissions—but side effects are unclear
items.description: Rising levels of the potent greenhouse gas prompt “delicate” steps into new kind of geoengineering

items.title: In ‘blow to the environment,’ EPA begins to dismantle its research office
items.description: Extensive layoffs could have wide-ranging impacts on conservation and human health

items.title: Can portable headsets peer into the minds of hunter-gatherers and other understudied populations?
items.description: <cite>Science</cite> chats with health economist Shailender Swaminathan about how compact EEGs could reveal the impact of culture and environment on the brain

items.title: Employees’ protests against Trump science policies spread to NSF
items.description: Letter to key House Democrat follows declarations by scientists at NIH, EPA, and NASA

items.title: Watch an earthquake split a hillside in two
items.description: Footage of massive Myanmar temblor provides the first video evidence of earthquake ruptures
